table.name: Reference_Item
table.description: This table is basically used for creating parent/child relationships for Enumeration and Lookup tables. Since it has no columns, no physical table will exist so it becomes a simple logical placeholder.

column.name: id
column.descr: The value associated with a single enum

column.name: caption
column.descr: The name/text an end-user would see

column.name: abbrev
column.descr: An abbreviated form of the caption

column.name: group_name
column.descr: The group to which the lookup item belongs

column.name: sort_seq
column.descr: The sorting sequence within the group (if sorting differently than the ID or Caption

column.name: result
column.descr: The type of result after a lookup (the value that should be used for the lookup -- the id or caption or abbreviation)

column.name: remarks
column.descr: Any special remarks, usage instructions etc.

table.name: $parenttbl_name$_$parentcol_Name$
table.description:
This table is a cache of its parent's text_set column. The contents of this table are updated automatically via a trigger. DO NOT INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE MANUALLY.
The "set" type column in the main table is actually a cache of all the set members in the child table. A set is limited to about 20-25 10-character member names. The column in the main table is a comma- separated list of text items. The child table is the exact same contents in a row-oriented format in a separate table (maintained by triggers).

column.name: parent_id
column.descr: The owner of the set member (this SHOULD be a foreign key, but causes a mutating trigger problem)
